title: Drawing, A Sepulchral Monument of Henry Cardinal York (1725-1807) and Charles Edward Stuart, the "Young Pretender" (1720-1788), ca. 1818
title_raw: A Sepulchral Monument of Henry Cardinal York (1725-1807) and Charles Edward Stuart, the "Young Pretender" (1720-1788)
markings: Watermark: crowned beehive showing HONIG - in the base, over: JHZ
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: The two half-figures are shown as standing behind the balustrade of a loggia. A canopy with the coat-of-arms of the Stuarts from the background. On top of a sepulchral chamber shown before the balustrade are: a young man in the attire of Hercules seated beside a cinerary receptacle upon which the insignia of a bishop and a helmet and sword lie on a cushion. The architectural setting is that of a lateral chapel in a church with framing lines.

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, A Sepulchral Monument of Henry Cardinal York (1725-1807) and Charles Edward Stuart, the "Young Pretender" (1720-1788), ca. 1818; ITALY & FRANCE; pencil, pen, wash, chinese ink; H x W: 65.8 × 44.1 cm (25 7/8 × 17 3/8 in.); Museum purchase through gift of various donors; 1901-39-2507
